post:
Hi,

I have a spare dedicated server, and it is about to expire.  I have no plans of renewing it.
It is under Kimsufi. Please make sure you already have an account so that we
can somewhat transfer it easily.

CPU: Core™ i3-2130
Cores/Threads: 2c/ 4t
Freq.: 3.4 GHz+
RAM: 8 GB
Disk: 1 TB
Network: 100 Mbps
IPv4: (I don't know the count of it, but it surely supports it)
IPv6: /128

Proof: 
![](http://i.imgur.com/dR2OTv8.png)

I paid the setup fee of €9.99 (euros) for it.
So it is up to you if you want to give the setup fee back to me :)

Thanks.

**_UPDATE:_**

It is possible to **_transfer the ownership_** of a specific server **_to another Kimsufi user_**.

I sent them an e-mail and here is their reply:

> Bonjour,
> 
> Je vous confirme qu'il est possible de changer le propriétaire de votre serveur. Le personne a qui vous souhaitez céder votre serveur doit se créer un compte Kimsufi.
> 
> Puis vous devez remplir la procédure de changer de propriétaire puis la faire parvenir.
> 
> La procédure est disponible via le lien suivant :
> https://www.ovh.com/fr/cgi-bin/fr/procedure/procedureChangeOwner.cgi
> 
> Je reste à votre disposition si nécessaire.
> 
> Cordialement,
> Mathieu H.
> ​Support Kimsufi

**English version:**

> Hello
> 
> I can confirm that it is possible to change the ownership of your server. The person has that you want to assign your server must create a Kimsufi account.
> 
> Then you must complete the procedure of change of owner and then forward it.
> 
> The procedure is available via the following link:
> https://www.ovh.com/fr/cgi-bin/fr/procedure/procedureChangeOwner.cgi
> 
> I remain at your disposal if necessary.
> 
> Kind regards
> Mathieu H.
> Support Kimsufi

This is the **_e-mail of Kimsufi support to me:_**

![](http://i.imgur.com/5TIZQcO.png)
